channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Unleashing Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Visual Perception
item.description: In this paper, we propose VPD (Visual Perception with a pre-trained Diffusion model), a new framework that exploits the semantic information of a pre-trained text-to-image diffusion model in visual perception tasks.

item.title: Revisiting Adversarial Training for ImageNet: Architectures, Training and Generalization across Threat Models
item.description: While adversarial training has been extensively studied for ResNet architectures and low resolution datasets like CIFAR, much less is known for ImageNet.

item.title: Benchmarking White Blood Cell Classification Under Domain Shift
item.description: Recognizing the types of white blood cells (WBCs) in microscopic images of human blood smears is a fundamental task in the fields of pathology and hematology.

item.title: Prompt, Generate, then Cache: Cascade of Foundation Models makes Strong Few-shot Learners
item.description: Our CaFo incorporates CLIP's language-contrastive knowledge, DINO's vision-contrastive knowledge, DALL-E's vision-generative knowledge, and GPT-3's language-generative knowledge.

item.title: NovPhy: A Testbed for Physical Reasoning in Open-world Environments
item.description: But is it enough to only have physical reasoning capabilities to operate in a real physical environment?

item.title: Unleashing Text-to-Image Diffusion Models for Visual Perception
item.description: In this paper, we propose VPD (Visual Perception with a pre-trained Diffusion model), a new framework that exploits the semantic information of a pre-trained text-to-image diffusion model in visual perception tasks.

item.title: When does Privileged Information Explain Away Label Noise?
item.description: Leveraging privileged information (PI), or features available during training but not at test time, has recently been shown to be an effective method for addressing label noise.

item.title: 3D Multi-Object Tracking Based on Uncertainty-Guided Data Association
item.description: In the existing literature, most 3D multi-object tracking algorithms based on the tracking-by-detection framework employed deterministic tracks and detections for similarity calculation in the data association stage.

item.title: BSH-Det3D: Improving 3D Object Detection with BEV Shape Heatmap
item.description: Specifically, we design the Pillar-based Shape Completion (PSC) module to predict the probability of occupancy whether a pillar contains object shapes.

item.title: Learning Permutation-Invariant Embeddings for Description Logic Concepts
item.description: We reformulate the learning problem as a multi-label classification problem and propose a neural embedding model (NERO) that learns permutation-invariant embeddings for sets of examples tailored towards predicting $F_1$ scores of pre-selected description logic concepts.

item.title: Learning Common Rationale to Improve Self-Supervised Representation for Fine-Grained Visual Recognition Problems
item.description: Specifically, we fit the GradCAM with a branch with limited fitting capacity, which allows the branch to capture the common rationales and discard the less common discriminative patterns.

item.title: CONTAIN: A Community-based Algorithm for Network Immunization
item.description: Within the network analysis field, network immunization refers to the task of protecting a network from some arbitrary diffusion that tries to infect it.

item.title: T360RRD: A dataset for 360 degree rotated rectangular box table detection
item.description: To address the problem of scarcity and high annotation costs of rotated image table detection datasets, this chapter proposes a method for building a rotated image table detection dataset.

item.title: TRUSformer: Improving Prostate Cancer Detection from Micro-Ultrasound Using Attention and Self-Supervision
item.description: We analyze this method using a dataset of micro-ultrasound acquired from 578 patients who underwent prostate biopsy, and compare our model to baseline models and other large-scale studies in the literature.

item.title: Learning Energy Conserving Dynamics Efficiently with Hamiltonian Gaussian Processes
item.description: Hamiltonian mechanics is one of the cornerstones of natural sciences.

item.title: Quantifying the LiDAR Sim-to-Real Domain Shift: A Detailed Investigation Using Object Detectors and Analyzing Point Clouds at Target-Level
item.description: Additional experiments reveal that this domain shift can be lowered by introducing a simple noise model in simulation.

item.title: Discovery and Recognition of Formula Concepts using Machine Learning
item.description: Our long-term goal is to generalize citation-based IR methods and apply this generalized method to both classical references and mathematical concepts.

item.title: Generative Diffusions in Augmented Spaces: A Complete Recipe
item.description: Score-based Generative Models (SGMs) have achieved state-of-the-art synthesis results on diverse tasks.

item.title: DWFormer: Dynamic Window transFormer for Speech Emotion Recognition
item.description: Self-attention mechanism is applied within windows for capturing temporal important information locally in a fine-grained way.

item.title: PAGE: A Position-Aware Graph-Based Model for Emotion Cause Entailment in Conversation
item.description: Conversational Causal Emotion Entailment (C2E2) is a task that aims at recognizing the causes corresponding to a target emotion in a conversation.

item.title: Sparsity May Cry: Let Us Fail (Current) Sparse Neural Networks Together!
item.description: In pursuit of a more general evaluation and unveiling the true potential of sparse algorithms, we introduce "Sparsity May Cry" Benchmark (SMC-Bench), a collection of carefully-curated 4 diverse tasks with 10 datasets, that accounts for capturing a wide range of domain-specific and sophisticated knowledge.

item.title: Investigating the Translation Performance of a Large Multilingual Language Model: the Case of BLOOM
item.description: The NLP community recently saw the release of a new large open-access multilingual language model, BLOOM (BigScience et al., 2022) covering 46 languages.

item.title: Depth-based 6DoF Object Pose Estimation using Swin Transformer
item.description: To tackle this challenge, we propose a novel framework called SwinDePose, that uses only geometric information from depth images to achieve accurate 6D pose estimation.

item.title: POPGym: Benchmarking Partially Observable Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Real world applications of Reinforcement Learning (RL) are often partially observable, thus requiring memory.

item.title: Robust Detection Outcome: A Metric for Pathology Detection in Medical Images
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose Robust Detection Outcome (RoDeO); a novel metric for evaluating algorithms for pathology detection in medical images, especially in chest X-rays.

item.title: Chemically Transferable Generative Backmapping of Coarse-Grained Proteins
item.description: Coarse-graining (CG) accelerates molecular simulations of protein dynamics by simulating sets of atoms as singular beads.

item.title: ACL-SPC: Adaptive Closed-Loop system for Self-Supervised Point Cloud Completion
item.description: Point cloud completion addresses filling in the missing parts of a partial point cloud obtained from depth sensors and generating a complete point cloud.

item.title: Defending against Adversarial Audio via Diffusion Model
item.description: In this paper, we propose an adversarial purification-based defense pipeline, AudioPure, for acoustic systems via off-the-shelf diffusion models.

item.title: Less is More: Mitigate Spurious Correlations for Open-Domain Dialogue Response Generation Models by Causal Discovery
item.description: In this paper, we conduct the first study on spurious correlations for open-domain response generation models based on a corpus CGDIALOG curated in our work.

item.title: DeepSeer: Interactive RNN Explanation and Debugging via State Abstraction
item.description: The core of DeepSeer is a state abstraction method that bundles semantically similar hidden states in an RNN model and abstracts the model as a finite state machine.

item.title: MLANet: Multi-Level Attention Network with Sub-instruction for Continuous Vision-and-Language Navigation
item.description: For a better performance in continuous VLN, we design a multi-level instruction understanding procedure and propose a novel model, Multi-Level Attention Network (MLANet).

item.title: ConTEXTual Net: A Multimodal Vision-Language Model for Segmentation of Pneumothorax
item.description: In this work, we develop a vision-language model for the task of pneumothorax segmentation.

item.title: DeepLens: Interactive Out-of-distribution Data Detection in NLP Models
item.description: In this work, we propose DeepLens, an interactive system that helps users detect and explore OOD issues in massive text corpora.

item.title: Sparse MoE as the New Dropout: Scaling Dense and Self-Slimmable Transformers
item.description: Despite their remarkable achievement, gigantic transformers encounter significant drawbacks, including exorbitant computational and memory footprints during training, as well as severe collapse evidenced by a high degree of parameter redundancy.

item.title: SHAP-IQ: Unified Approximation of any-order Shapley Interactions
item.description: SHAP-IQ is based on a novel representation and, in contrast to existing methods, we provide theoretical guarantees for its approximation quality, as well as estimates for the variance of the point estimates.

item.title: Specformer: Spectral Graph Neural Networks Meet Transformers
item.description: To tackle these issues, we introduce Specformer, which effectively encodes the set of all eigenvalues and performs self-attention in the spectral domain, leading to a learnable set-to-set spectral filter.

item.title: Discrete-time Competing-Risks Regression with or without Penalization
item.description: Additionally, we showcase the utility of our procedure by estimating a survival model for the length of stay of patients hospitalized in the intensive care unit, considering three competing events: discharge to home, transfer to another medical facility, and in-hospital death.

item.title: Geometric Visual Similarity Learning in 3D Medical Image Self-supervised Pre-training
item.description: We propose a novel visual similarity learning paradigm, Geometric Visual Similarity Learning, which embeds the prior of topological invariance into the measurement of the inter-image similarity for consistent representation of semantic regions.

item.title: Hyperparameter Tuning and Model Evaluation in Causal Effect Estimation
item.description: We also find hyperparameter tuning and model evaluation are much more important than causal estimators and ML methods.

item.title: STUNT: Few-shot Tabular Learning with Self-generated Tasks from Unlabeled Tables
item.description: Learning with few labeled tabular samples is often an essential requirement for industrial machine learning applications as varieties of tabular data suffer from high annotation costs or have difficulties in collecting new samples for novel tasks.

item.title: Can BERT Refrain from Forgetting on Sequential Tasks? A Probing Study
item.description: Large pre-trained language models help to achieve state of the art on a variety of natural language processing (NLP) tasks, nevertheless, they still suffer from forgetting when incrementally learning a sequence of tasks.

item.title: Practical Network Acceleration with Tiny Sets: Hypothesis, Theory, and Algorithm
item.description: For 22% latency reduction, it surpasses previous methods by on average 7 percentage points on ImageNet-1k.

item.title: Language Variety Identification with True Labels
item.description: Research has shown that this is a problematic assumption, particularly in the case of very similar languages (e. g., Croatian and Serbian) and national language varieties (e. g., Brazilian and European Portuguese), where texts may contain no distinctive marker of the particular language or variety.

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Guided Multi-Objective Exam Paper Generation
item.description: To reduce the repetitive and complex work of instructors, exam paper generation (EPG) technique has become a salient topic in the intelligent education field, which targets at generating high-quality exam paper automatically according to instructor-specified assessment criteria.

item.title: Pay Less But Get More: A Dual-Attention-based Channel Estimation Network for Massive MIMO Systems with Low-Density Pilots
item.description: Additionally, with the proposed transfer learning approach, the DACEN-based method with ultra-low-density pilots ($\rho_L^\prime=2/52$) achieves higher estimation accuracy than the existing methods with low-density pilots, thereby demonstrating the effectiveness and the superiority of the proposed method.

item.title: Conflict-Based Cross-View Consistency for Semi-Supervised Semantic Segmentation
item.description: In this work, we propose a new conflict-based cross-view consistency (CCVC) method based on a two-branch co-training framework for semi-supervised semantic segmentation.

item.title: Reasoning-Based Software Testing
item.description: We introduce Reasoning-Based Software Testing (RBST), a new way of thinking at the testing problem as a causal reasoning task.

item.title: DAVA: Disentangling Adversarial Variational Autoencoder
item.description: We compare DAVA to models with optimal hyperparameters.

item.title: MuscleMap: Towards Video-based Activated Muscle Group Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we tackle the new task of video-based Activated Muscle Group Estimation (AMGE) aiming at identifying currently activated muscular regions of humans performing a specific activity.

item.title: Why (and When) does Local SGD Generalize Better than SGD?
item.description: Local SGD is a communication-efficient variant of SGD for large-scale training, where multiple GPUs perform SGD independently and average the model parameters periodically.
